response.answer_text: MIS stands for Management Information System. MIS uses IT to record,store & process data to produce information that decision makers can use to make day to day decisions.An MIS executive is responsible for maintaining existing MIS of an organisation The role of MIS executive varies as per the companies requirements. Typical job role of MIS executive is to maintain data and extract reports. This reports are used by business owners to help them evaluate their business daily activities,make decisions & track progress of the company. Important skill set associated with an MIS executive is knowledge of MS EXCEL,VBA ,database technologies like MS ACCESS, SQL, Oracle etc and reporting technologies like Tableau,SAP business Objects,QlickView etc.Learning different technologies helps MIS executive for fast career growth.

An MIS executive would be any position within a company that has responsibility for the computer systems, processes and services. Executives are usually in charge of budgets and several layers of management, who have the direct report employees doing the actual work. Examples would be CIO, Director, Information Systems, or Manager, Information Systems. There are many other executive positions in the IT field, from operations to development to financial. Post secondary education can open up doors for those opportunities. Thanks, Will England
